meanings.definition: A type of inflorescence in which the flowers are clustered together in a dense, compact head.
meanings.sent1: The anthodium of the sunflower contains many small flowers tightly packed together.
meanings.sent2: The florist arranged the anthodium of roses in a beautiful bouquet.
meanings.sent3: At the flower show, the anthodium of daisies looked like a colorful pom-pom.
meanings.sent4: The anthodium of the fireworks display lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
meanings.sent5: In the garden, the anthodium of the hydrangea caught the attention of every visitor.

meanings.definition: The collective term for the outermost layer of cells in a plant embryo.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the anthodium to understand the development of plant embryos.
meanings.sent2: The anthodium protects the delicate cells of the plant embryo during growth.
meanings.sent3: The tiny anthodium of the seed holds the potential for new life within.
meanings.sent4: Like a shield, the anthodium shields the plant embryo from harm.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the anthodium reveals the intricate structure of the plant embryo.
